channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: H&M plunges 13% on doubts over full-year margin target, June sales outlook
item.description: Shares of H&M plunged more than 14% Thursday morning after the company reported a smaller-than-expected increase in second quarter profits.

item.title: Europe wants to send data centers into space — study says it's possible
item.description: Europe is exploring the possibility of launching data centers, which consume vast amounts of electricity, into space.

item.title: ‘A disastrous event’: All-out war between Israel and Hezbollah could devastate both sides
item.description: Hezbollah, considered to be among the most heavily armed non-state groups in the world, is estimated to have 10 times the military capability of Hamas.

item.title: China sets mid-July for highly anticipated ‘Third Plenum’ meeting to discuss 'deepening reform'
item.description: China's top leaders will gather from July 15 to 18 for a highly anticipated meeting known as the Third Plenum, state media announced Thursday.

item.title: Inside Europe's tech hubs: France's AI push puts it on the rise
item.description: France has looked to position itself as Europe's leading artificial intelligence hub, with companies like Mistral AI and H getting large amounts of funding.

item.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang addresses rising competition at shareholder meeting after historic stock surge
item.description: Since last year's meeting, Nvidia has been on a historic run.

item.title: In a new round of 'panda diplomacy,' China sends giant bears to the U.S. after two decades
item.description: After 21 years, giant pandas are en route from China to the U.S. — a sign that Beijing is resuming its "panda diplomacy" efforts as relations with the West thaw.

item.title: Amazon plans to launch discount store in bid to fend off Temu and Shein
item.description: Amazon's storefront would directly compete with Temu and Shein, two emerging e-commerce sites with ties to China that have grown in popularity in the U.S.

item.title: Forget to-do lists. Here are 4 tips on how to stop procrastinating
item.description: In a world that is increasingly distractible, learning how to harness our attention is the "skill of the century," says best-selling author Nir Eyal.

item.title: Onboard forests, street markets and reefs: Disney releases details about its new cruise in Singapore
item.description: The Disney Adventure will sail three- and four-night voyages from Singapore starting in 2025, with the capacity to carry some 6,700 passengers on board.

item.title: India's water crisis could lead to unrest, hurt economic growth, Moody's warns
item.description: Severe water shortages in India could hurt its sovereign credit strength, according to Moody's Ratings.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Micron slides, Amazon's $2 trillion
item.description: The S&P 500 and Dow Jones closed slightly higher, while Nasdaq Composite increased by 0.49%, with Nvidia recovering. Amazon's market cap surpassed $2 trillion.

item.title: Japanese yen hits weakest level against dollar since 1986, reigniting intervention speculation
item.description: The yen weakened to 160.82 against the greenback according to FactSet data, breaching the previous record of 160.03 on April 29.

item.title: China's EV architect says investing in Europe is a way forward
item.description: Wan Gang became China's minister of Science and Technology around 2010 and is known for spearheading the country's early push into electric cars.

item.title: This Southeast Asian city is the world's most expensive for the super rich — Hong Kong comes second
item.description: The price of owning a car in Singapore — the most expensive globally at 2.5 times the average — soared 15% from a year earlier in U.S. dollar terms.

item.title: Federal Reserve says all 31 banks in annual stress test withstood a severe hypothetical downturn
item.description: This year's stress test included JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs, credit card companies including American Express and regional lenders such as Truist.

item.title: Amazon reaches $2 trillion market cap for the first time
item.description: The company joins other tech heavyweights, such as Nvidia, Apple, Alphabet and Microsoft, all of which have crossed a $2 trillion market capitalization.

item.title: U.S. ambassador accuses China of undermining bilateral ties, Wall Street Journal reports
item.description: This comes after ties between the U.S. and China have somewhat warmed after Xi and Biden met in November.

item.title: Micron shares slide after revenue forecast fails to top estimates
item.description: Micron reported better-than-expected results on Wednesday, but the stock declined on a forecast that was only in line with estimates.

item.title: Trade feuds aside, Chinese firms are committed to the U.S. market, survey shows
item.description: A survey of Chinese enterprises in the U.S. has found that a majority remain bullish on the market long-term despite concerns about U.S.-China relations.

item.title: SpaceX is building a NASA craft to intentionally destroy the International Space Station after retiring
item.description: NASA will have a spacecraft from Elon Musk's SpaceX guide the International Space Station's destruction after its retirement.

item.title: Biden Cabinet officials roll out new plans to cut costs of living ahead of Trump debate
item.description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and over a dozen other White House Cabinet members are making stops around the U.S. ahead of the Biden-Trump debate.

item.title: Morgan Stanley wealth advisors are about to get an OpenAI-powered assistant to do their grunt work
item.description: The rollout will be a real-world test for the vaunted productivity gains of generative AI, which took the world by storm in late 2022.

item.title: Google is testing facial recognition technology for campus security, starting at site near Seattle
item.description: According to internal documents, Google is testing facial recognition technology at a site in Kirkland, Washington.

item.title: Levi's shares drop 12% as jeans maker's sales disappoint despite denim craze
item.description: Levi's has been working to build out its own website and stores, and while the strategy has lifted profits, sales aren't budging much.

item.title: Rivian investment a ‘catch-up move’ for Volkswagen that could take years to pay off, advisory firm says
item.description: Volkswagen’s $5 billion investment in electrical vehicle startup Rivian is a “catch-up move” for the German automaker, Cyrus Mewawalla says.

item.title: Southwest Airlines cuts revenue forecast, blaming changing booking patterns
item.description: The company said it still expects record quarterly operating revenue in the second quarter.

item.title: YouTube dominates streaming, forcing media companies to decide whether it's friend or foe
item.description: YouTube is gaining share of viewership on TVs, and legacy media doesn't have a uniform strategy to deal with the threat.

item.title: European stocks close lower as euro extends declines; tech firms nudge higher
item.description: European stocks closed lower Wednesday, extending negative sentiment seen in the previous trading session.

item.title: Delta's most exclusive airport lounge opens. Here's what's inside
item.description: The Delta One lounge is the airline's latest effort to reel in customers and offers perks like massages, showers and a high-end restaurant.
